name: Bridger Town
description: The only landable base on Kumay and the start/finish line for our expedition. There's a race track around the base which we can utilise while waiting for everyone to gather

name: Cinder Toffee Mountain
description: Possibly our first hurdle after leaving Bridger

name: The Lithops Mesa
description: A pair of flat topped hills resembling the Lithops succulent on the edge of a complex canyon area and next to a crater with a nice central mound.

name: The Grand Canyon Craters
description: A crater (one of two actually) up on the plain at the start of a red rock canyon complex.

name: Coluber's Folly
description: A blue stain like a wide dry river bed across red desert, shallow crater at the end.

name: Blue Cliff Valley
description: Nice blue cliff lined valley.

name: Blue Vein Valley
description: A blue bottomed valley cutting through red dessert landscape which leads to a larger pair of heart shaped blue basins.

name: The Northern Route
description: A whole series of craters and valleys en-route from Blue Vein Valley to the North Pole.

name: Sulphur Peak
description: A 7km high peak in a range of sulphurous mountains which form the 'fire' half of the 'Fire And Ice Mountains'

name: The North Pole
description: The North Pole of Kumay

name: Manaslu peak
description: Huge ice peak, at least 4.5km above ground level. The peak is so massive, it creates its own dark side. The 'ice' half of the 'Fire And Ice Mountains'

name: Raccoon Ridge
description: Chain of mountains of various heights and colouring.

name: Blue Powder Gap
description: A shallow valley of rolling light powder blue.

name: O'Donnell Settlement
description: A non-landable settlement at which we hope to have some fun (including 'The O'Donnell Leap' and a game of 'Hide and Seek'). Note that you may run into a security perimeter if you have oustanding bounties!

name: The Jumble
description: Area of dark treacherous foothills which may have to be crossed enroute to geo site #14.

name: Claw Ridge Maze
description: A mess of ravines every which way. Halfway between Claw Ridge and #14.

name: Claw Ridge
description: Claw shaped series of valleys, halfway to the Cliffs of Insanity.

name: The Cliffs Of Insanity
description: Approx. 6km high range of fairly gnarly mountains 500km South of O'Donnel.

name: The Tusken Wastes
description: An extensive area of clay red canyons and craters.

name: Horseshoe Crater
description: Very large crater with small crater and mound plus many features.

name: Dewdrop Crater
description: Small deep crater with steep center mound.

name: Buttercup Mountains
description: Mountains separated by a yellow plain.

name: The Naga Canyon
description: Narrow and deep (1-1.5km) canyon running S-SW of the BCM and cutting through some large craters

name: The South Pole
description: The Southern Pole of Kumay

name: The Southern Ghosts
description: Field of eerily lit craters in the dark near the South pole.

name: Knievel's Jump
description: A reasonably narrow canyon to jump across.

name: ZigZag Point
description: Around 235km from Geological #16 and 370km to GFC. One of many canyons in the area. Heading here from #16 and then to GrimFaceCrater ensures most interesting terrain along the way.

name: Grim Face Crater
description: Very large crater with an interesting valley cutting through it.

name: The Corona Basin
description: Shallow crater with bright spots and nice central mound at the Northern end of the canyon complex halfway between Grim Face Crater and The Termite Mound.

name: The Termite Mound
description: Classic nipple in the middle of a medium size pink crater in the middle of a large hot pink desert.
